newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Adecco gains approval for Ecco share buy.
newsitem.headline: Adecco gains approval for Ecco share buy.

text.p: Swiss-French temporary employment firm Adecco SA said it had gained permission from French authorities to buy the remaining shares outstanding in Ecco which it does not already own.
Adecco already holds 98.33 percent of Ecco's shares.
Adia was formed earlier this year from a merger of Swiss temp firm Adia, and French firm Ecco.

"Through a decision on November 29, the French market oversight body, 'Conseil de Marches Financiers,' approved the conditions for a public buy-back offer of Ecco shares, with an obligatory delisting of the shares from stock exchange trade," Adecco said in a statement.
Adecco will buy all shares offered for sale between December 3 and 16 at a price of 1,270 French francs.
Transactions in shares still outstanding after the public offer will be coordinated by Paris-based Lazard Freres et Cie.
